intro: Cryptophoranthus powellii, commonly known as the Powell's cryptophyta, is a rare flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers that are typically clustered in dense heads. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
